document_data.caption: From left to right: [[Lyrissa]], [[Kiera]], and Tiralia
document_data.name: Tiralia
document_data.basicrefs: {{Cite polyhedron/55/The New Rogues Gallery: Iron Maidens|20}}
document_data.mainbody: '''Tiralia''' was a female [[adventurer]] and [[wizard]] who traveled as part of the [[Iron Maidens]] adventuring company in the 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Description: Tiralia was a [[human]] that originally stood {{SI|5'6"|ft-in|long=yes}}, but later walked at a height of {{SI|8'2"|ft-in|long=yes}} after an incident with a [[spell]] going wrong. She was rather attractive, had a fair complexion, and sported curly red hair that dropped down to her shoulders.
document_data.Personality: Tiralia was extremely flirtatious and never failed to attract attention. When it came to fight, she preferred to use her incredible strength and [[staff]], using her wizard spells to protect her or improve her chances in close-quarter combat.
document_data.Abilities: After her incident with a spell gone wrong, Tiralia had strength equivalent to that of an [[ogre]] and could wield weapons suitable for a [[hill giant]].
document_data.Possessions:
As a wizard Tiralia possessed a number of magical items. These included ''[[ring of djinni summoning]]'', a ''[[ring of protection]] +2'', a ''[[wand of fireballs]]'', and a ''[[wand of magic missiles]]''. In terms of non-magical items, she carried an [[ironwood]] staff that was {{SI|9|ft|long=yes}} in length and {{SI|3|in|long=yes}} thick.

Tiralia also possessed [[spellbook]]s that contained and allowed her to cast the spells ''[[alter self]]'', ''[[audible glamer]]'', ''[[blur]]'', ''[[Cantrip (spell)|cantrip]]'', ''[[deeppockets]]'', ''[[dispel magic]]'', ''[[feather fall]]'', ''[[fog cloud]]'', ''[[friends]]'', ''[[invisibility]]'', ''[[read magic]]'', ''[[shield (spell)|shield]]'', ''[[slow]]'', ''[[stinking cloud]]'', and ''[[wizard lock]]''.
document_data.History: Tiralia grew up not knowing her parents, living among nobles as a successful courtesan. Eventually she grew tired of life among nobility and used all the money she had earned to enroll at a school of [[magic]]. She managed to learn there for two years before her funds had depleted, after which she left to become an adventurer. After a long journey, she joined the Iron Maidens adventuring company,{{Cite polyhedron/55/The New Rogues Gallery: Iron Maidens|19}}
